Cost Allocation Tags: Enable cost allocation tags and then tag away!
The cost allocation report will then break down cost by tag and also for untagged resources so you can see what you are spending

limits: Free to use UI, $0.01 per paginated API request
Once you turn it on you can't turn it off
Up to 12 months of historical data, current month, and projections for 3 months
When first turned on it takes a day to get current usage, and a few more days for the rest

Cost 'Types'.name: Unblended
Cost 'Types'.description: The costs on they day they are charged.  Things like reserved instances which charge an upfront cost may show as spikes on the first of the month.

Cost 'Types'.name: Amortized
Cost 'Types'.description: Distributes one time charges across the month

Cost 'Types'.name: Blended
Cost 'Types'.description: Just ignore this, only useful in special circumstances that most never encounter.

Budgets.description: AWS Budgets information is updated up to three times a day. Budgets track your unblended costs, subscriptions, refunds, and RIs (Reserved Instance)

types.name: Usage
types.description: Plan/track spending on one or more services

types.name: RI Utilization
types.description: Define utilization thresholds for RIs and get alerts if it falls below

types.name: RI Coverage
types.description: Track fraction of instances that are covered by RI and get alert if it falls below defined thresholds

types.name: Savings Plan Utilization
types.description: Define utilization thresholds for savings plans and get alerts if it falls below

pricing: First 62 budget days are free every month, so you can have 2 free budgets

Cost Categories.description: Organize costs with a rules engine approach.  Generate cost categories, make rules about how resources are divided into categories, and then categories show up in Cost Categories, AWS Budgets, and AWS CUR
